analyzed: uvāca saṃmukham devīm labdha kāmā vasuṃdharā
translated: then spoke to the Goddess, having obtained her desire, the Earth said:

original: dṛṣṭvā śriyaṃ devadevasya viṣṇor gṛhītapādāṃ tapasā jvalantīm /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā śriyam devadevasya viṣṇoḥ gṛhīta pādām tapasā jvalantīm
translated: Seeing Shri, the Goddess of the God of gods, Vishnu, with her feet held, blazing with penance,

original: sutaptajāmbūnadacāruvarṇāṃ papraccha devīṃ vasudhā prahṛṣṭā // / //🔽unnidrakokanadacārukare vareṇye unnidrakokanadanābhigṛhītapāde /🔽unnidrakokanadasadmasadāsthitīte unnidrakokanadamadhyasamānavarṇe // / //
analyzed: su tapta jāmbūnada cāru varṇām papraccha devīm vasudhā prahṛṣṭā  unnidra kokanada cāru kare vareṇye unnidra kokanada nābhi gṛhīta pāde  unnidra kokanada sadma sadā sthiti ite unnidra kokanada madhya samāna varṇe
translated: having the beautiful color of well-heated gold, the delighted Earth asked the Goddess:🔽O you whose hands are beautiful like fully bloomed red lotuses, O you whose feet are held by the navel like a fully bloomed red lotus,🔽O you who always reside in the abode of a fully bloomed red lotus, O you who have the same color as the center of a fully bloomed red lotus,

analyzed: nīla abja netre tapanīya varṇe śukla ambare ratna vibhūṣita aṅgi
translated: O you with eyes like blue lotuses, O you of golden complexion, O you with white garments, O you whose body is adorned with jewels,

analyzed: candra ānane sūrya samāna bhāse mahā prabhāve jagataḥ pradhāne
translated: O you with a moon-like face, O you who shine like the sun, O you of great radiance, O you who are foremost in the world,

original: tvam eva nidrā jagataḥ pradhānā lakṣmīr dhṛtiḥ śrīr viratir jayā ca /
analyzed: tvam eva nidrā jagataḥ pradhānā lakṣmīḥ dhṛtiḥ śrīḥ viratiḥ jayā ca
translated: You alone are the sleep, the foremost in the world, the prosperity, the fortitude, the glory, the abstinence, the victory,

original: kāntiḥ prabhā kīrtir atho vibhūtiḥ sarasvatī vāg atha pāvanī ca // / //
analyzed: kāntiḥ prabhā kīrtiḥ atho vibhūtiḥ sarasvatī vāc atha pāvanī ca
translated: The beauty, the radiance, the fame, the splendor, the Saraswati, the speech, and the purifier,

original: svadhā titikṣā vasudhā pratiṣṭhā sthitiḥ sudīkṣā ca tathā sunītiḥ /
analyzed: svadhā titikṣā vasudhā pratiṣṭhā sthitiḥ sudīkṣā ca tathā sunītiḥ
translated: The svadha, the forbearance, the earth, the foundation, the stability, the good initiation, and the good policy,

original: khyātir viśālā ca tathānasūyā svāhā ca medhā ca tathaiva buddhiḥ // / //
analyzed: khyātiḥ viśālā ca tathā anasūyā svāhā ca medhā ca tathā eva buddhiḥ
translated: Khyati, Vishala, Anasooya, Svaha, Medha, and Buddhi.

original: ākramya sarvaṃ tu yathā trilokīṃ tiṣṭhaty ayaṃ devavaro 'sitākṣi /
analyzed: ākramya sarvam tu yathā trilokīm tiṣṭhati ayam sita akṣi
translated: Just as this best of gods, O black-eyed one, stands after conquering the entire three worlds,

original: tathā sthitā tvaṃ varade tathāpi pṛcchāmy ahaṃ te vasatiṃ vibhūteḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā sthitā tvam vara de tathā api pṛcchāmi aham te vasatim vibhūteḥ
translated: in the same way, O bestower of boons, you also stand. Still, I ask you about the abode of your glory.

original: ity evam uktā vasudhāṃ babhāṣe lakṣmīs tadā devavarāgrataḥsthā /
analyzed: iti evam uktā vasudhām babhāṣe lakṣmīḥ tadā deva vara agratas sthā
translated: Thus addressed, Lakshmi, standing before the best of gods, spoke to the earth then:

original: sadā sthitāhaṃ madhusūdanasya devasya pārśve tapanīyavarṇe // / //
analyzed: sadā sthitā aham madhusūdanasya devasya pārśve tapanīya varṇe
translated: I always stand by the side of the golden-hued god Madhusudana.

original: asyājñayā yaṃ manasā smarāmi śriyā yutaṃ taṃ pravadanti santaḥ /
analyzed: asya ājñayā yam manasā smarāmi śriyā yutam tam pravadanti santaḥ
translated: By his command, the wise ones speak of him as united with Shri, whom I remember with my mind.

original: saṃsmāraṇe cāpy atha yatra cāhaṃ sthitā sadā tac chṛṇu lokadhātri // / //🔽vasāmy athārke ca niśākare ca tārāgaṇāḍhye gagane vimeghe /
analyzed: saṃsmāraṇe ca api atha yatra ca aham sthitā sadā tat śṛṇu lokadhātri  vasāmi atha arke ca niśākare ca tārā gaṇa āḍhye gagane vimeghe
translated: And in remembering him, O sustainer of the world, listen to where I always stand.🔽I dwell in the sun, in the moon, in the cloudless sky adorned with multitudes of stars,

original: meghe tathā lambapayodhare ca śakrāyudhāḍhye ca taḍitprakāśe // / //
analyzed: meghe tathā lamba payodhare ca śakrāyudha āḍhye ca taḍit prakāśe
translated: in the cloud with hanging breasts, adorned with Indra's bow and shining with lightning.

original: tathā suvarṇe vimale ca rūpye ratneṣu vastreṣv amaleṣu bhūme /
analyzed: tathā suvarṇe vimale ca rūpye ratneṣu vastreṣu amaleṣu bhūme
translated: And in pure gold, in silver, in gems, in pure garments, and on the earth,

analyzed: prāsāda mālāsu ca pāṇḍurāsu devālayeṣu dhvaja bhūṣiteṣu
translated: And in rows of white palaces, and in temples adorned with flags.

original: sadyaḥ kṛte cāpy atha gomaye ca matte gajendre turage prahṛṣṭe /🔽vṛṣe tathā darpasamanvite ca vipre tathaivādhyayanaprapanne // / //
analyzed: sadyas kṛte ca api atha gomaye ca matte gaja indre turage prahṛṣṭe  vṛṣe tathā darpa samanvite ca vipre tathā eva adhyayana prapanne
translated: And immediately after the performance, and on fresh cow dung, and on an intoxicated lordly elephant, and on a delighted horse,

original: siṃhāsane cāmalake ca bilve chatre ca śaṅkhe ca tathaiva padme /
analyzed: siṃhāsane ca āmalake ca bilve chatre ca śaṅkhe ca tathā eva padme
translated: And on a bull endowed with pride, and on a brahmin devoted to study, and on a lion throne, and on an amlaka, and on a bilva, and on an umbrella, and on a conch, and likewise on a lotus,

original: dīpte hutāśe vimale ca khḍga ādarśabimbe ca tathā sthitāham // / //
analyzed: dīpte hutāśe vimale ca khḍge ādarśa bimbe ca tathā sthitā aham
translated: And on a blazing fire, and on a clear sword, and likewise on a mirror image, I remain.

analyzed: pūrṇa uda kumbheṣu sa cāmareṣu sa tālavṛnteṣu vibhūṣiteṣu
translated: And on full water pots with chowries, with palm leaf fans, and adorned,

original: bhṛṅgārapātreṣu manohareṣu mṛdi sthitāhaṃ ca navoddhṛtāyām // / //
analyzed: bhṛṅgāra pātreṣu manohareṣu mṛdi sthitā aham ca nava uddhṛtāyām
translated: And on charming bhrngara vessels, I remain on fresh clay.

original: kṣīre tathā sarpiṣi śādbale ca kṣaudre tathā dadhni puraṃdhrigātre /
analyzed: kṣīre tathā sarpiṣi śādbale ca kṣaudre tathā dadhni puraṃdhri gātre
translated: And on milk, and on ghee, and on fresh grass, and on honey, and on curd, and on the body of a young woman,

original: dehe kumāryāś ca tathā surāṇāṃ tapasvināṃ yajñahutāṃ ca dehe // / //
analyzed: dehe kumāryāḥ ca tathā surāṇām tapasvinām yajña hutām ca dehe
translated: And on the body of a young girl, and likewise on the bodies of gods, ascetics, and sacrificial offerings,

original: śare ca saṃgrāmavinirgate ca sthitā mṛte svargasadaḥprayāte /
analyzed: śare ca saṃgrāma vinirgate ca sthitāḥ mṛte svarga sadaḥ prayāte
translated: And on an arrow, and on one who has emerged from battle, I remain, dead, on one who has gone to the abode of heaven.

original: vedadhvanau cāpy atha śaṅkhaśabde svāhāsvadhāyām atha vādyaśabde // / //
analyzed: veda dhvanau ca api atha śaṅkha śabde svāhā svadhāyām atha vādya śabde
translated: And in the sound of the Vedas, and also in the sound of conches, in the sound of svāhā and svadhā, and also in the sound of musical instruments,

original: rājyābhiṣeke ca tathā vivāhe yajñe vare snātaśirasy athāpi /
analyzed: rājya abhiṣeke ca tathā vivāhe yajñe vare snāta śirasi atha api
translated: And in the coronation of a king, and likewise in a wedding, in a sacrifice, and also on the head of one who has taken a bath,

original: puṣpeṣu śukleṣu ca parvateṣu phaleṣu ramyeṣu saridvarāsu // / //
analyzed: puṣpeṣu śukleṣu ca parvateṣu phaleṣu ramyeṣu sarit varāsu
translated: And in white flowers, and in mountains, and in beautiful fruits, and in the best of rivers,

original: saraḥsu pūrṇeṣu tathā jaleṣu saśādvalāyāṃ bhuvi padmakhaṇḍe /
analyzed: saraḥsu pūrṇeṣu tathā jaleṣu sa śādvalāyām bhuvi padma khaṇḍe
translated: In full lakes, and likewise in water, on soft ground, in a cluster of lotuses,

original: vane ca vatse ca śiśau prahṛṣṭe sādhau nare dharmaparāyaṇe ca // / //
analyzed: vane ca vatse ca śiśau prahṛṣṭe sādhau nare dharma parāyaṇe ca
translated: And in a forest, and in a calf, and in a child, and in one who is delighted, and in a righteous man, and in one devoted to dharma,

original: ācāraseviny atha śāstranitye vinītaveṣe ca tathā suveṣe /
analyzed: ācāra sevini atha śāstra nitye vinīta veṣe ca tathā su veṣe
translated: And in one who serves the ācāras, and in one who is always devoted to the scriptures, in one who is modestly dressed, and likewise in one who is well-dressed,

original: suśuddhadānte malavarjite ca mṛṣṭāśane cātithipūjake ca // / //
analyzed: su śuddha dānte mala varjite ca mṛṣṭa aśane ca atithi pūjake ca
translated: In one who is very pure and self-controlled, and in one who is free from dirt, in one who eats pure food, and in one who worships guests,

original: svadāratuṣṭe nirate ca dharme dharmotkaṭe cātyaśanād vimukte /
analyzed: sva dāra tuṣṭe nirate ca dharme dharma utkaṭe ca ati aśanāt vimukte
translated: In one who is content with one's own wife, and in one who is devoted to dharma, and in one who is zealous in dharma, and in one who is free from excessive eating,

original: sadā sapuṣpe sasugandhigātre sugandhalipte ca vibhūṣite ca // / //
analyzed: sadā sa puṣpe sa sugandhi gātre su gandha lipte ca vibhūṣite ca
translated: In one who is always adorned with flowers, and in one whose body is fragrant, in one who is anointed with perfumes, and in one who is ornamented,

original: satye sthite bhūtahite niviṣṭe kṣamānvite krodhavivarjite ca /
analyzed: satye sthite bhūta hite niviṣṭe kṣamā anvite krodha vivarjite ca
translated: In one who is established in truth, and in one who is devoted to the welfare of beings, in one who is endowed with patience, and in one who is free from anger,

original: svakāryadakṣe parakāryadakṣe kalyāṇacitte ca sadā vinīte // / //
analyzed: sva kārya dakṣe para kārya dakṣe kalyāṇa citte ca sadā vinīte
translated: In one who is skillful in one's own affairs, and in one who is skillful in the affairs of others, in one who has a benevolent mind, and in one who is always modest,

analyzed: nārīṣu nityam su vibhūṣitāsu pativratāsu priya vādinīṣu
translated: To women who are always well-adorned, devoted to their husbands, sweet-spoken,

analyzed: a mukta hastāsu suta anvitāsu su gupta bhāṇḍāsu bali priyāsu
translated: Not letting go of their hands, endowed with good children, with well-guarded utensils, fond of offerings,

analyzed: saṃmṛṣṭa veśmāsu jita indriyāsu kali vyapetāsu a vilolupāsu
translated: With well-swept houses, with controlled senses, free from quarrels, not greedy,

original: dharmavyapekṣāsu dayānvitāsu sthitā sadāhaṃ madhusūdane ca // / //
analyzed: dharma vyapekṣāsu dayā anvitāsu sthitā sadā aham madhusūdane ca
translated: Devoted to dharma, full of compassion, I always remain in Madhusudana.

original: nimeṣamātraṃ ca vinā kṛtāhaṃ na jātu tiṣṭhe puruṣottamena // / //
analyzed: nimeṣa mātram ca vinā kṛtā aham na jātu tiṣṭhe puruṣottamena
translated: Without even a moment's separation, I am never separated from Purushottama.

original: dharmaśāstram idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ svayaṃ devena bhāṣitam /
analyzed: dharma śāstram idam śreṣṭham svayam devena bhāṣitam
translated: This is the best of dharma scriptures, spoken by the Lord Himself.

original: ye dvijā dhārayiṣyanti teṣāṃ svarge gatiḥ parā // / //
analyzed: ye dvijāḥ dhārayiṣyanti teṣām svarge gatiḥ parā
translated: Those twice-born who will uphold it, their attainment in heaven is supreme.

original: idaṃ pavitraṃ maṅgalyaṃ svargyam āyuṣyam eva ca /
analyzed: idam pavitram maṅgalyam svargyam āyuṣyam eva ca
translated: This is purifying, auspicious, conducive to heaven and longevity,

analyzed: jñānam ca eva yaśasyam ca dhana saubhāgya vardhanam
translated: Knowledge, fame, and increases wealth and good fortune.

original: adhyetavyaṃ dhāraṇīyaṃ śrāvyaṃ śrotavyam eva ca /
analyzed: adhyetavyam dhāraṇīyam śrāvyam śrotavyam eva ca
translated: It should be studied, retained, taught, and listened to,

original: śrāddheṣu śrāvaṇīyaṃ ca bhūtikāmair naraiḥ sadā // / //
analyzed: śrāddheṣu śrāvaṇīyam ca bhūti kāmaiḥ naraiḥ sadā
translated: And always heard at funeral ceremonies by men who desire prosperity.

original: ya idaṃ paṭhate nityaṃ bhūtikāmo naraḥ sadā /
analyzed: yaḥ idam paṭhate nityam bhūti kāmaḥ naraḥ sadā
translated: A man who always desires prosperity and recites this daily,

original: idaṃ rahasyaṃ paramaṃ kathitaṃ ca dhare tava // / //
analyzed: idam rahasyam paramam kathitam ca dhare tava
translated: This supreme secret has been told to you, O Earth.

original: mayā prasannena jagaddhitārthaṃ saubhāgyam etat paramaṃ yaśasyam /
analyzed: mayā prasannena jagat hita artham saubhāgyam etat paramam yaśasyam
translated: By me, being pleased, for the welfare of the world, this is the highest good fortune, this is the most glorious,

analyzed: duḥsvapna nāśam bahu puṇya yuktam śiva ālayam śāśvata dharma śāstram
translated: The destroyer of bad dreams, endowed with much merit, the abode of Shiva, the eternal Dharma Shastra.

original: End of Part end of Viṣṇu /
analyzed: end of part
translated: End of Part End of Vishnu.
